summary: The TDD is complete, deterministic, fully traceable to upstream artifacts, resolves all SAD deferred decisions, and defines explicit interfaces, failure handling, and testing strategy.

warnings.description: Section 4 includes TypeScript-like type definitions inline. While these define contracts (which is the TDD's role), they are close to implementation code. This is acceptable for a TDD but should not be treated as final implementation signatures.

Execution loop detail (Deferred Decision 4 resolution) introduces a new subcommand pattern 'sdlc exec <phase> <work-item-id>' that is not in the original PRD command list (generate, validate, freeze, status). This is within scope (PRD FR-8 requires execution loop support) but should be noted.
warnings.location: Section 11 — Resolution of SAD Deferred Decisions, Deferred 4
